page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY C. CROOKHAM
page.content: Local place names.{Gally Hill Road. Gallows formerly at top of hill used for hanging criminals.{Quetta Park. {Now Army married}quarters, named after battle of Quetta.{Cadet way {originally Haig Lines, an}army Cadet Training camp,now residential. {Malthouse Close _ }malthouse demolished for residential building. {The Church. The opening of Christ Church in the parish of "Crookham_cum_Ewshot"in 1840 was the start of the development of this part of the old village of Crookham. It was followed by the building of several large "gentleman's houses",and in 1843 a church shool. Alms houses were provided in 1854 Two holders of the{V.C.have lived {here,}General Johnson,in Gally Hill Road near the church, & Rambahadur Limbu who lived at the Gurkha Barricks
